title: Methodologie
text:
Welkom bij de AlgoSoc AI Monitor, die inzicht geeft in de publieke percepties en ervaringen met kunstmatige intelligentie (AI) en geautomatiseerde besluitvormingssystemen (ADM) in de samenleving! We hebben 3946 respondenten in Nederland gevraagd wat ze hierover denken.

Dit dashboard bundelt gegevens die zijn verzameld via het AlgoSoc Consortium om weer te geven hoe burgers denken en voelen over AI in de samenleving. Het dashboard is onderverdeeld in drie hoofdpagina’s.
Klik op een van de onderstaande knoppen voor snelle navigatie:


  Betrokkenheid    Houdingen
   Waarden 


Als je meer wilt weten over AlgoSoc en ons werk over AI, bezoek ons dan op algosoc.org!

Methodologie
In deze eerste golf van gegevensverzameling zijn 3946 deelnemers geïnterviewd over belangrijke vragen rond algoritmen en publieke waarden in de sectoren gezondheid, justitie en media. De gegevens zijn in maart 2024 verzameld als onderdeel van het Centerdata LISS panel.

title: AlgoSoc AI Monitor
text:
This dashboard aggregates data collected via the AlgoSoc Consortium to show how citizens think and feel about AI in society.
If you want to know more about AlgoSoc and our work on AI, visit us on algosoc.org!

Methodology
This first wave of data collection interviewed a total of 3,921 participants on key questions surrounding algorithms and public values across the sectors of health, justice and media. The data was collected as part of Centerdata’s LISS panel throughout March of 2024.

title: Detecting AI-Generated Content
text:
The page is divided into three main sections:


  Detecting AI-Generated Content    Trust in ADM Systems    Future of ADM Systems 


Each section allows you to examine overall trends as well as breakdowns by age, gender, education level, and political leaning.

 Detecting AI-Generated Content

How confident are you that the following groups can tell the difference between content created by AI and content created by people?


OverallBy AgeBy GenderBy EducationBy Politics


















































 Trust in ADM Systems

We ask you a number of additional questions about automatic decision-making (ADM) systems. These are computer programs that make decisions that used to be made by people. These decisions are made automatically by computers based on data.


How confident are you that automated decision-making systems can properly determine…


OverallBy AgeBy GenderBy EducationBy Politics


















































 Future of ADM Systems

If automated decision-making (ADM) becomes more common in the future, what do you think will happen?


OverallBy AgeBy GenderBy EducationBy Politics

title: Most Important Values
text:
The page is divided into four main sections:


  Most Important Values    Usefulness of AI    Riskiness of AI    Fairness of AI 


Each section allows you to examine overall trends as well as breakdowns by age, gender, education level, and political leaning.

 Most Important Values

What do you consider the 5 most important values for automated decision-making systems? [only top important value shown]


OverallBy AgeBy GenderBy EducationBy Politics


















































 Usefulness of AI
In most predictions, automated decision-making will become more common in the future. If so, to what extent do you disagree or agree with the following statements:

More automatic decision-making in news media/the legal system/healthcare will be useful.


OverallBy AgeBy GenderBy EducationBy Politics


















































 Riskiness of AI
In most predictions, automated decision-making will become more common in the future. If so, to what extent do you disagree or agree with the following statements:

More automatic decision-making in news media/the legal system/healthcare will be risky.


OverallBy AgeBy GenderBy EducationBy Politics


















































 Fairness of AI

In most predictions, automated decision-making will become more common in the future. If so, to what extent do you disagree or agree with the following statements:


More automatic decision-making in news media/the legal system/healthcare will be more fair.


OverallBy AgeBy GenderBy EducationBy Politics

title: Ability to Recognize and Influence AI
text:
The page is divided into four main sections:


  Ability to Recognize and Influence AI 
  Usage of AI Systems    Exposure to AI    Familiarity with AI terms 


Each section allows you to examine overall trends as well as breakdowns by age, gender, education level, and political leaning.

 Ability to Recognize and Influence AI

With artificial intelligence (AI), computer programs can perform tasks themselves and also learn themselves. AI is increasingly used in society, and also in online media. Many websites use AI to show you more content and ads you like. The following questions are about the offers (such as articles, films or songs) that are shown to you on websites and apps for news and entertainment (e.g. Netflix or Spotify).


To what extent do you agree or disagree with the following statements?


OverallBy AgeBy GenderBy EducationBy Politics


















































 Usage of AI Systems

How often in the past year did you use…


OverallBy AgeBy GenderBy EducationBy Politics



























































 Exposure to AI

Artificial Intelligence (AI) can be used to create artificial content such as text, images and videos.


How often do you think you have come across the following things on social media in the past year?


OverallBy AgeBy GenderBy EducationBy Politics


















































 Familiarity with AI terms

How familiar are you with the following terms?


OverallBy AgeBy GenderBy EducationBy Politics
